original: dge slong de de'i drung du song nas /
analyzed: dge slong de de'i drung du song nas /
translated: the monk went to his door,

original: dal nas dal nas sgo 'phar la brdungs pa dang / de dus las 'das bas ga la zhig lan 'debs te /🔽des re zhig 'di ngal bas nyal te /
analyzed: dal nas dal nas sgo 'phar la brdungs pa dang / de dus las 'das bas ga la zhig lan 'debs te / des re zhig 'di ngal bas nyal te /
translated: and slowly, slowly he knocked on the door. Since the other had died, how could he answer?

original: rang ldang grang snyam du bsams pa dang / ji tsam na dro la bab par gyur te /
analyzed: rang ldang grang snyam du bsams pa dang / ji tsam na dro la bab par gyur te /
translated: He thought, “For a while he must have been tired and gone to sleep.🔽When he wakes up, he will get up.”🔽When it was time for the meal,

original: dge slong de yang de'i drung du song nas sgo 'phar la drag tu brdungs te /
analyzed: dge slong de yang de'i drung du song nas sgo 'phar la drag tu brdungs te /
translated: the monk went to his door and knocked loudly on the door.

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: “Venerable one!

original: dro la bab kyi /
analyzed: dro la bab kyi /
translated: It is time for the meal.

original: longs shig ces smras pa dang / gnas khang stong par 'dug pas ga la zhig lan yod de /
analyzed: longs shig ces smras pa dang / gnas khang stong par 'dug pas ga la zhig lan yod de /
translated: “Get up!” he said, but the room was empty.🔽The monks asked him, “Why did you knock on the door?”

original: de la dge slong dag gis ci'i phyir sgo 'phar brdungs zhes smras pa dang / des ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par brjod do //
analyzed: de la dge slong dag gis ci'i phyir sgo 'phar brdungs zhes smras pa dang / des ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par brjod do //
translated: He told them what had happened.

original: dge slong dag gis lde mig kyog po blangs te sgo phye ba dang / ji tsam na dus las 'das par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis lde mig kyog po blangs te sgo phye ba dang / ji tsam na dus las 'das par mthong ngo //
translated: The monks took a skeleton key and opened the door. When they saw him, he had died.

original: de dag gis phan tshun du brtags na sbrul gdug pa zhig mal gyi 'og tu non nas dus las 'das par mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag gis phan tshun du brtags na sbrul gdug pa zhig mal gyi 'og tu non nas dus las 'das par mthong ste /
translated: They looked around and saw that a poisonous snake had been crushed under the bed and had died.

original: de na kha cig @341a *//
analyzed: de na kha cig @341a *//
translated: Some of them said,

original: gis tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni sbrul gdug pa 'dis zos pas dus las 'das so //
analyzed: gis tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni sbrul gdug pa 'dis zos pas dus las 'das so //
translated: “The venerable one died because he was eaten by a poisonous snake.”🔽Some of them said,

original: de na kha cig ni 'di yang tshe dang ldan pa 'dis lus bsgyur bas dus las 'das so //
analyzed: de na kha cig ni 'di yang tshe dang ldan pa 'dis lus bsgyur bas dus las 'das so //
translated: “The venerable one died because he changed his body.”

original: zhes de'i skabs dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: zhes de'i skabs dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about this, and the Blessed One thought,🔽“What are the causes and conditions for this?”

original: nyes dmigs gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang yin pa ni /
translated: What is the problem?

original: dge slong mal stan gtams pas mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la ma gtad cing dus dus su ma brtags pa las gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong mal stan gtams pas mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la ma gtad cing dus dus su ma brtags pa las gyur te /
translated: A monk who had spread out bedding did not entrust it to the bedding attendant and did not check it from time to time.

original: de lta bas na mal stan gtams par gyur pa des mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la gtad par bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na mal stan gtams par gyur pa des mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la gtad par bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, a monk who has spread out bedding should entrust it to the bedding attendant.🔽He should roll it up and hang it on a robe rack.

original: bltab ste chos gos kyi gdang bu la dgal bar bya bar mkhyen nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bltab ste chos gos kyi gdang bu la dgal bar bya bar mkhyen nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One knew this and said,

original: dge slong dag dge slong des ni bag med pa byas pas nyes dmigs su gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong des ni bag med pa byas pas nyes dmigs su gyur te /
translated: “Monks, that monk was careless and that was a problem.

original: de lta bas na dge slong gang la mal stan gtams par gyur pa des ci nus kyis skoms la lto ba ste mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la gtod cig /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gang la mal stan gtams par gyur pa des ci nus kyis skoms la lto ba ste mal stan gyi zhal ta pa la gtod cig /
translated: Therefore, a monk who has spread out bedding should dry it as much as possible and entrust it to the bedding attendant.

analyzed: yang na lto ba la chos gos kyi gdang bu la bkal te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Or he should hang it on a robe rack.

original: gang zhig nyal bar byed na yang mal stan la brtags te nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig nyal bar byed na yang mal stan la brtags te nyal bar bya'o //
translated: If he is going to sleep, he should check the bedding before he sleeps.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mal stan la nyal bar 'dod pa des mal stan la rtog la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mal stan la nyal bar 'dod pa des mal stan la rtog la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “One who wishes to lie down on a bed should examine the bed and then lie down.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag gis me mar la mal stan rtog pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag gis me mar la mal stan rtog pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” They examined the bed by the light of a lamp, and the Blessed One said, “

original: mal stan me mar la brtags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mal stan me mar la brtags par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not examine the bed by the light of a lamp.

original: 'on kyang nyin par mal stan brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyin par mal stan brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should examine the bed in the daytime.

original: dge slong dag gis mal stan thams cad glongs @341b pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis mal stan thams cad glongs @341b pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The monks took down all the beds, and the Blessed One said,

analyzed: gang yun ring du bzhag pa de dag ni gzhi nas glongs la brtag par bya'o //
translated: “Those that have been left for a long time should be taken down from the ground and examined.

original: bting ba gzhan ni sprugs la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bting ba gzhan ni sprugs la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The other beds should be shaken out and then used.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
translated: The Story of the Two Monks in Śrāvastī

original: dge slong gnyis shig gnas khang gcig na gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong gnyis shig gnas khang gcig na gnas te /
translated: Two monks were staying in the same dwelling.

original: de gnyis las gcig gis gzhon nu gzhan zhig rab tu phyung ba dang / de rab tu gnyid che ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de gnyis las gcig gis gzhon nu gzhan zhig rab tu phyung ba dang / de rab tu gnyid che ba zhig ste /
translated: One of them gave the going forth to another young man, who slept a lot.

original: ring zhig na ldang ba dang / de la mkhan po rtag tu gshe'o //
analyzed: ring zhig na ldang ba dang / de la mkhan po rtag tu gshe'o //
translated: After a long time he got up, and the preceptor always scolded him.

analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na ring zhig gnyid kyis log pa dang / sdangs te langs nas rdul zan sham thabs su gyon te /
translated: After a long time he fell asleep, and when he woke up he put on his dust-covered robes.

original: de bzhin du mkhan po'i drung du song ba dang / de yang mal nas langs nas sham thabs gyon cing 'dug pa de'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag 'tshal ba dang / de yang skra dang kha spu bregs nas ring po ma lon pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhan po'i drung du song ba dang / de yang mal nas langs nas sham thabs gyon cing 'dug pa de'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag 'tshal ba dang / de yang skra dang kha spu bregs nas ring po ma lon pas /
translated: He went to the preceptor, and the preceptor got up from his bed and put on his lower robe. The preceptor bowed his head to the feet of the preceptor, and the preceptor had not long before shaved his head and face.

original: de langs pa'i mgo la mkhan po'i sham thabs thogs nas lhung ste sgren mor gyur /
analyzed: de langs pa'i mgo la mkhan po'i sham thabs thogs nas lhung ste sgren mor gyur /
translated: The preceptor’s lower robe fell on the head of the one who had gotten up, and he became naked.

original: de'i rdul zan yang lhung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rdul zan yang lhung bar gyur te /
translated: The dust-covered robe also fell off.

original: gnyis ka sgren mor gyur cing /
analyzed: gnyis ka sgren mor gyur cing /
translated: Both of them became naked.

original: ji ltar tshul mi sdug par 'dug pa gnas khang gcig na gnas pas mthong ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul mi sdug par 'dug pa gnas khang gcig na gnas pas mthong ste /
translated: They were staying in the same room, and he saw them.

original: des tshe dang ldan pa dag bzang ngo //
analyzed: des tshe dang ldan pa dag bzang ngo //
translated: He said, “Venerables, it is good.

original: ji ltar skyes bu khyed skyes bu'i mtshan dang ldan par ngas gdod shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu khyed skyes bu'i mtshan dang ldan par ngas gdod shes so //
translated: “I only now know that you are a man with the marks of a man.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / gnyis ka skyengs te spobs pa med par song nas /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / gnyis ka skyengs te spobs pa med par song nas /
translated: Both of them were embarrassed and left without saying anything.

original: des slob ma de la spyos pa dang / de la dge slong dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: des slob ma de la spyos pa dang / de la dge slong dag gis smras pa /
translated: He scolded his student, and the monks said to him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la de bzhin du rtag tu gshe bar gyur na khyod kyis ci zhig byas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la de bzhin du rtag tu gshe bar gyur na khyod kyis ci zhig byas /
translated: “Venerable, if he always scolds you like that, what will you do?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerable sirs,

original: 'di dang sngon ni lhan cig 'dum par @342a *//
analyzed: 'di dang sngon ni lhan cig 'dum par @342a *//
translated: it was all right for me to reconcile with him before,

original: rung na / da ni 'dum par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rung na / da ni 'dum par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: but now I will not reconcile with him.

original: gshed gcig tu 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gshed gcig tu 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: I will go to the execution ground.”

original: de dag gis ci las gyur ces smras pa dang / des ji ltar gyur pa de dag la rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: de dag gis ci las gyur ces smras pa dang / des ji ltar gyur pa de dag la rgyas par smras so //
translated: They asked him, “What happened?” and he told them in detail what had happened.

original: de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa khyod nyid kyis nyes pas /🔽gshe ba ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa khyod nyid kyis nyes pas /🔽gshe ba ni gnas yin no //
translated: They said, “Venerable, you yourself are at fault.🔽It is right for him to scold you.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / de cang mi smra bar gyur ba de'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / de cang mi smra bar gyur ba de'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: dge slong des de la spyos pa ni gnas yin te /
analyzed: dge slong des de la spyos pa ni gnas yin te /
translated: “It is right for that monk to scold him.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: de lta bas na nyes dmigs gang yin pa ni chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed cing /
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes dmigs gang yin pa ni chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed cing /
translated: therefore, the disadvantages are that one should not bow to someone wearing only one robe,

analyzed: chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed pa bdag gir byed pa ste /
translated: and one should not accept being bowed to by someone wearing only one robe.

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag mi bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, monks, you should not bow to someone wearing only one robe,🔽and you should not accept being bowed to by someone wearing only one robe.

analyzed: chos gos gcig gyon pas kyang phyag byed pa bdag gir bya ba ma yin par mkhyen nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Understanding this, the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong des de la spyos pa ni gnas yin te /
analyzed: dge slong des de la spyos pa ni gnas yin te /
translated: “It is right for that monk to scold him.

original: dge slong dag /🔽de lta bas na dge slong chos gos gcig gyon pa des kyang phyag mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong dag / de lta bas na dge slong chos gos gcig gyon pa des kyang phyag mi bya /
translated: Monks,🔽therefore, a monk wearing only one robe should not bow to someone wearing only one robe,

original: chos gos gcig gyon pa la yang phyag mi bya /
analyzed: chos gos gcig gyon pa la yang phyag mi bya /
translated: and a monk wearing only one robe should not accept being bowed to by someone wearing only one robe.

analyzed: chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed pa yang bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not take pride in being saluted while wearing a single robe.

original: dge slong dag /🔽chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed dam /🔽chos gos gcig gyon pa la phyag byed dam /
analyzed: dge slong dag / chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed dam / chos gos gcig gyon pa la phyag byed dam /
translated: Monks,🔽one should not salute while wearing a single robe,🔽one should not salute one who is wearing a single robe,

analyzed: chos gos gcig gyon pas phyag byed pa bdag gir byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: one should not take pride in saluting while wearing a single robe.

original: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: The Setting was the Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @342b dge slong rnams dge slong gis tshul khrims ma rig par ngal bso bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, a monk should not rest while ignorant of the moral code.”

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yul so so na gnas pa'i dge slong dag grong dang / grong khyer dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor de dang de dag nas /🔽mchod rten la phyag byed du lhags pa de dag la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yul so so na gnas pa'i dge slong dag grong dang / grong khyer dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor de dang de dag nas / mchod rten la phyag byed du lhags pa de dag la /
translated: Then monks living in various regions, having come to make obeisance at stūpas in various towns, cities, countries, and royal palaces,

original: gang gis kyang ngal ma bsos te /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ngal ma bsos te /
translated: were not refreshed by anyone.

analyzed: bskrad nas khyams dang / sgo khang dang / them skas dang / sgo khang gi khyams dang / shing drung dag tu de dag gnas pa dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag ma dad pa kha cig gis mthong nas /
translated: Some non-Buddhist brahmins and householders saw them and said,

analyzed: 'phags pa khyed cag gtsug lag khang nas bskrad dam ci na 'di bzhin du 'dug /
translated: “Noble ones, were you driven out of the monastery? Why are you staying here?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: bzhin bzang nged ni gtsug lag khang nas bskrad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin bzang nged ni gtsug lag khang nas bskrad pa ma yin te /
translated: “Good sirs, we were not driven out of the monastery.

original: 'on kyang glo bur du lhags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang glo bur du lhags pa yin no //
translated: We are just visitors.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis gnas khang dag ma byin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis gnas khang dag ma byin nam /
translated: “Noble ones, did your fellow practitioners not give you a place to stay?”🔽They said,

original: de dag gis bzhin bzang nged kyi tshul khrims mi shes pas /
analyzed: de dag gis bzhin bzang nged kyi tshul khrims mi shes pas /
translated: “Good sirs, since you do not know our moral discipline,

original: su zhig nged la gnas khang gi skabs 'byed par byed /
analyzed: su zhig nged la gnas khang gi skabs 'byed par byed /
translated: who would give us a place to stay?”

original: gang ci ltar yang rung /
analyzed: gang ci ltar yang rung /
translated: “Whatever the case,

analyzed: 'dir gnas te mchod rten la phyag byas nas rang gi gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: stay here, pay homage to the stūpa, and then go to your own place.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snyoms pa'o zhes thos na /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snyoms pa'o zhes thos na /
translated: “The Śākya son’s monks have equal discipline.”

original: de ji ltar snyoms pa'i tshul khrims de /
analyzed: de ji ltar snyoms pa'i tshul khrims de /
translated: “How is their discipline equal?

original: tshangs pa mtshungs pa'i spyod pa blo bur du 'ongs pa la yang gnas khang sbyin par mi byed do //🔽zhes de dag rmod par byed /🔽'phya bar byed /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs pa'i spyod pa blo bur du 'ongs pa la yang gnas khang sbyin par mi byed do // zhes de dag rmod par byed / 'phya bar byed /
translated: They don’t even give a room to a guest practitioner of pure conduct.”🔽They disparaged,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed pa de'i skabs dge @343a *//
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed pa de'i skabs dge @343a *//
translated: sneered at, and ridiculed them.

original: slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ngas bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ngas bca' bar bya ste /
translated: “I will establish rules for the conduct of guest monks.

original: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pas rgan pa bzhi la phyag byos la /
analyzed: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pas rgan pa bzhi la phyag byos la /
translated: When a guest monk arrives, he should bow to the four elders

original: de'i mdun du 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du 'dug par bya'o //
translated: and sit in front of them.

original: de dag gis kyang de la gus par gyis la /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de la gus par gyis la /
translated: They should respect him

original: ngal sor gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: ngal sor gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: and make him rest.

original: gnas khang dang / mal stan gyi zhal ta bas kyang mal stan sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas khang dang / mal stan gyi zhal ta bas kyang mal stan sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The monk in charge of bedding should give bedding to the newly arrived monk.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis glo bur du 'ongs pa'i dge slong gis rgan pa bzhi la phyag byas te mdun du 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis glo bur du 'ongs pa'i dge slong gis rgan pa bzhi la phyag byas te mdun du 'dug par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‘A newly arrived monk should bow to the four elders and sit in front of them.’

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / ji tsam na dge slong gzhan zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba las rgyal po'i khab tu phyin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / ji tsam na dge slong gzhan zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba las rgyal po'i khab tu phyin te /
translated: So it happened that a monk was traveling through the countryside and arrived at Rājagṛha.

original: des dge slong dag la tshe dang ldan pa gnas brtan kun shes ko'u di n+ya gang na zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /🔽'od ma'i tshal na'o //
analyzed: des dge slong dag la tshe dang ldan pa gnas brtan kun shes ko'u di n+ya gang na zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis smras pa / 'od ma'i tshal na'o //
translated: He asked the monks, “Where is the elder monk, the venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya?”🔽“In Bamboo Grove,” they replied.

original: de 'od ma'i tshal du song ste /
analyzed: de 'od ma'i tshal du song ste /
translated: He went to Bamboo Grove.🔽He slowly and gently knocked on the door of Ājñātakauṇḍinya’s dwelling.

translated: He went to the Pāṇḍava Cave and

original: zhes smras so //

analyzed: gnas brtan chen po skul byed la yang phyag 'tshal na de gang na bzhugs gsungs shig / des smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bya rgod phung po'i ri la 'dug gi der song zhig / de bya rgod phung po'i ri la song ste /

analyzed: des kyang tshe dang ldan pa nang du zhugs la ngal sos shig ces smras pa dang / des smras pa /

analyzed: zhes smras so //

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: bdag ni glo bur du mchis pa ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: bdag ni glo bur du mchis pa ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lags so //
translated: “I am a visitor named so-and-so.”

analyzed: des kyang tshe dang ldan pa nang du zhugs la ngal sos shig ces smras pa @344a *//
translated: He also said, “Venerable one, enter and rest.”

original: dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: dang / des smras pa /
translated: He said,

analyzed: gnas brtan da ni nam yang nangs te /

analyzed: bsod snyoms la yang 'jug dgos na /
translated: Since we must go out for alms,

original: ji ltar ngal bso mchi'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bdag cag glo bur du lhags pa lam gyis dub pa rnams chad pas dgum pa'i las kyi don du rgan pa bzhi la glo bur du 'ongs pas phyag byos shig /

translated: how can we rest?”

original: ces gsungs ngo //
analyzed: ces gsungs ngo //
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‘For the sake of punishing those of us who have suddenly arrived and are exhausted from the road, the four elders should pay homage to the newly arrived.’

original: zhes de'i skabs dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes de'i skabs dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag ngas sa la 'dug go cog gi gnas brtan la ma gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas sa la 'dug go cog gi gnas brtan la ma gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Monks, although I have not spoken about the elder of every place on earth,

original: 'on kyang gtsug lag khang na gnas pa de nyid kyi gnas brtan la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtsug lag khang na gnas pa de nyid kyi gnas brtan la phyag bya'o //
translated: nevertheless, in the monastery, one should pay homage to the elder of that very place.

original: sdom ni / ston la ngag ldan gyis zhus nas /
analyzed: sdom ni / ston la ngag ldan gyis zhus nas /
translated: The summary: Spoken by Vātsīputra to the Teacher,

original: mkhan po'i rjes su spyad pa dang / ri dvags la ni lnga brgya dang / tha mar gyur pa bdun brgya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po'i rjes su spyad pa dang / ri dvags la ni lnga brgya dang / tha mar gyur pa bdun brgya'o //
translated: practicing after the preceptor, five hundred deer, and finally seven hundred.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada's Park.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag ldan dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag ldan dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the venerable Vātsīputra, rising from his afternoon meditation,🔽went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet,🔽and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: Having sat to one side,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa dag ldan gyis 'di skad gsol to //
translated: the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: btsun pa dge slong lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis mkhan po dang / slob dpon la ji @344b ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: “Lord, how should monks who are co-residents and students serve their preceptors and teachers?”

original: ngag ldan / dge slong lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis kun tu spyad pa'i chos ngas yang dag par bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngag ldan / dge slong lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis kun tu spyad pa'i chos ngas yang dag par bca' bar bya'o //
translated: “Ānanda, I will lay down the rules for monks who are co-residents and students.

original: dge slong lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis nang par sngar langs te /🔽mkhan po dang slob dpon la khams mnyam mam /
analyzed: dge slong lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis nang par sngar langs te / mkhan po dang slob dpon la khams mnyam mam /
translated: Monks who are co-residents and students should rise early in the morning,🔽and ask, ‘Preceptor, are you well?’

original: zhes dri bar bya'o //🔽gal te mkhan po khams mi mnyam mo //
analyzed: zhes dri bar bya'o // gal te mkhan po khams mi mnyam mo //
translated: and ‘Teacher, are you well?’

original: zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes zer na /
translated: If the preceptor or teacher says, ‘Preceptor, I am not well,’🔽or ‘Teacher, I am not well,’

analyzed: de'i nad dris te sman pa la bzhin bzang bdag gi mkhan po 'di 'dra bar na bar gyur na /
translated: then they should ask about the illness, saying, ‘Sir, since our preceptor or teacher is ill like this,

original: sman ston cig ces dris la /
analyzed: sman ston cig ces dris la /
translated: please prescribe medicine.’

original: ji ltar bsgo ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgo ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: They should do as they are told.

original: de ltar 'byor na legs /
analyzed: de ltar 'byor na legs /
translated: If he is able to obtain them, it is good.

original: gal te ma 'byor na de'i nye du dag la bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma 'byor na de'i nye du dag la bslang bar bya'o //
translated: If he is not able to obtain them, he should request them from the relatives of the preceptor.

original: gal te nye du mang por gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nye du mang por gyur na /
translated: If there are many relatives,

original: des mkhan po'i nye du gang las sman bslang bar bgyi zhes dri zhing /
analyzed: des mkhan po'i nye du gang las sman bslang bar bgyi zhes dri zhing /
translated: he should ask, “From which relative of the preceptor should I request medicine?”

original: gang la bstan pa de'i drung nas bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bstan pa de'i drung nas bslang bar bya'o //
translated: He should request it from the one who is indicated.

original: nye du med na bram ze dang / khyim bdag gang la bstan pa de las bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye du med na bram ze dang / khyim bdag gang la bstan pa de las bslang bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no relatives, he should request it from the brahmin or householder who is indicated.

original: gal te de lta bu yang med na sman khang nas bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta bu yang med na sman khang nas bslang bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one like that, he should request it from the hospital.

original: gal te de nas kyang ma rnyed na rang gis las la blta zhing bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / myang ba tsam la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de nas kyang ma rnyed na rang gis las la blta zhing bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / myang ba tsam la gnas par bya'o //
translated: If he does not find it there, he should look at his karma and live on just food, drink, and medicine.

original: ji ste min bar gyur pa zhig na so shing bza' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: ji ste min bar gyur pa zhig na so shing bza' bar bya zhing /
translated: If he is not able to do that, he should chew a tooth stick.

original: phyogs gang du mkhan pos so shing bor ba'i phyogs su phyag dar dang / dkyil 'khor byas nas sta na gding zhing /
analyzed: phyogs gang du mkhan pos so shing bor ba'i phyogs su phyag dar dang / dkyil 'khor byas nas sta na gding zhing /
translated: In the direction in which the preceptor throws the tooth stick, he should sweep and make a maṇḍala, and then he should sit.

original: chu snod dang / chol zangs dang / 'dag chal dang / so shing gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu snod dang / chol zangs dang / 'dag chal dang / so shing gzhag par bya'o //
translated: a water vessel,🔽a spittoon, a tooth cleaner, and a toothpick holder.

original: so shing bor nas chol zangs bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: so shing bor nas chol zangs bslang bar bya'o //
translated: After throwing away the tooth cleaner, he should take up the spittoon.

original: gal te mig nad can zhig na /🔽sman pas bsgo ba'i mig sman sbyar @345a *//
analyzed: gal te mig nad can zhig na / sman pas bsgo ba'i mig sman sbyar @345a *//
translated: If he has an eye disease,

original: bar bya ste /
analyzed: bar bya ste /
translated: he should prepare the eye medicine as prescribed by the doctor.

original: mig sman sbyar nas sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: mig sman sbyar nas sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: Having prepared the eye medicine, he should give it to the patient,

original: de slar yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de slar yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: and the patient should take it.

original: chos gos dag kyang sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: chos gos dag kyang sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: He should also give him a Dharma robe.

original: nam chos gos bgos nas mchod rten dag la phyag byed na /
analyzed: nam chos gos bgos nas mchod rten dag la phyag byed na /
translated: When the patient has put on the Dharma robe and paid homage to the stūpas,

original: de nas gnas khang chag chag gis gdab cing phyag dar bya'o //🔽gal te rdul yod par gyur na ba lang gi lci ba'am /
analyzed: de nas gnas khang chag chag gis gdab cing phyag dar bya'o // gal te rdul yod par gyur na ba lang gi lci ba'am /
translated: he should then sprinkle and sweep the dwelling.🔽If there is dust, he should smear it with cow dung

original: lo ma sngon pos ji tsam pa de byug par bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma sngon pos ji tsam pa de byug par bya'o //
translated: or with green leaves, as much as is necessary.

original: de nas mchod rten la phyag bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas mchod rten la phyag bya zhing /
translated: Then he should pay homage to the stūpas

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la yang ci nus kyis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la yang ci nus kyis phyag bya'o //
translated: and to the fellow practitioners of the holy life, as much as he can.

original: de nas bsam gtan dang / klog pa'i sbyor bas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan dang / klog pa'i sbyor bas gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then he should live by applying himself to meditation and recitation.

original: dus tshod shes nas lhung bzed gnyis bkrus te /
analyzed: dus tshod shes nas lhung bzed gnyis bkrus te /
translated: Knowing the time, he should wash the two alms bowls.

original: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig na lhung bzed lci ba de dag gis bkur bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig na lhung bzed lci ba de dag gis bkur bar bya zhing /
translated: If one is an alms-goer, he should carry the heavy bowl.

original: gang yang ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He should give the light one to the preceptor.

original: gal te gang grang ba'i dus su gyur na snam sbyar gang lci ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te gang grang ba'i dus su gyur na snam sbyar gang lci ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: If it is cold weather, he should give the heavy cloak to the preceptor.

original: gang yang ba de bdag gis bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang ba de bdag gis bgo bar bya'o //
translated: He should wear the light one himself.

original: ji ste dro ba zhig tu gyur na gang yang ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: ji ste dro ba zhig tu gyur na gang yang ba de mkhan po la sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: If it is warm weather, he should give the light cloak to the preceptor.

original: gang lci ba de bdag gis bkur bar bya'o //🔽gal te lam mi bde bar gyur na sngon du 'gro bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gang lci ba de bdag gis bkur bar bya'o // gal te lam mi bde bar gyur na sngon du 'gro bar bya zhing /
translated: He should carry the heavy one himself.🔽If the road is difficult, he should go first.

original: ci ste bde ba zhig na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste bde ba zhig na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If it is easy, he should go behind.

original: gal te chu rgal bar gyur na mkhan po'i lag pa nas bzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chu rgal bar gyur na mkhan po'i lag pa nas bzung bar bya'o //
translated: If he has to cross water, he should hold the hand of the preceptor.

original: spyod yul du 'gro ba na mkhan po la /
analyzed: spyod yul du 'gro ba na mkhan po la /
translated: When going to the alms-round, he should say to the preceptor:

original: mkhan po bsod snyoms la lhan cig gshegs sam /
analyzed: mkhan po bsod snyoms la lhan cig gshegs sam /
translated: “Preceptor, shall we go together for alms?”

original: 'on te so sor gshegs /
analyzed: 'on te so sor gshegs /
translated: Or do they go separately?🔽

original: zhes dris shig /
analyzed: zhes dris shig /
translated: Or, ‘Did you go separately?’

original: gal te lhan cig go zhes @345b zer na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig go zhes @345b zer na /
translated: If he says, ‘We went together,’

original: de bzhin du lhan cig tu 'gro bar bya zhing song ba las gal te phye zhig rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig tu 'gro bar bya zhing song ba las gal te phye zhig rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o //
translated: then you should go together. If you find a separate meal, take it in your own bowl.

original: ci ste 'bras chan zhig na ni mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig /🔽ces smra bar bya'o //🔽mon sran gre'u las byas pa'am /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras chan zhig na ni mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig / ces smra bar bya'o // mon sran gre'u las byas pa'am /
translated: If you find rice, put it in your preceptor’s bowl.

original: 'bras phye las byas pa'i bza' ba rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras phye las byas pa'i bza' ba rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o //
translated: If you find a meal made of beans or rice powder, take it in your own bowl.

original: ci ste bza' ba kha na da zhig rnyed na mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig /🔽ces smra bar bya'o //🔽ci ste dar ba bskol ba'am /🔽rtsab mo'i khu ba bskol pa zhig rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o //🔽ci ste 'o ma'am /
analyzed: ci ste bza' ba kha na da zhig rnyed na mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig / ces smra bar bya'o // ci ste dar ba bskol ba'am / rtsab mo'i khu ba bskol pa zhig rnyed na bdag gi lhung bzed du blang bar bya'o // ci ste 'o ma'am /
translated: If you find a meal that is not suitable for you, put it in your preceptor’s bowl.🔽If you find a meal of boiled jujube or boiled barley, take it in your own bowl.

original: zho'am / khu ba sbyar ba zhig na mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig /
analyzed: zho'am / khu ba sbyar ba zhig na mkhan po'i lhung bzed du lhugs shig /
translated: If you find milk, curd, or a milk-based meal, put it in your preceptor’s bowl.

original: ces smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces smra bar bya'o //
translated: He should say this.

original: de nas gnas khang du phyin nas dkyil 'khor gnyis bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas gnas khang du phyin nas dkyil 'khor gnyis bya zhing /
translated: Then, having gone to the living quarters, he should prepare two maṇḍalas.

original: lo ma lhags pa dag blangs nas /
analyzed: lo ma lhags pa dag blangs nas /
translated: Having taken the fallen leaves,

original: stan gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: stan gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
translated: he should lay out two seats.

original: de nas 'dug ste zas kyi bya ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dug ste zas kyi bya ba bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting down, he should do the work of eating.

original: ci ste bsod snyoms la so sor song na /
analyzed: ci ste bsod snyoms la so sor song na /
translated: If, on the other hand, he goes out separately for alms,

original: bsod snyoms blangs pa dag mkhan po la /
analyzed: bsod snyoms blangs pa dag mkhan po la /
translated: having taken the alms, he should say to the preceptor,

original: mkhan po bsod snyoms 'di ni bdag gis rnyed do //🔽de las gang bzhed pa de blang du gsol zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po bsod snyoms 'di ni bdag gis rnyed do // de las gang bzhed pa de blang du gsol zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: “Preceptor, I have obtained this alms.🔽Please take whatever you like from it.”

original: des kyang de la tshod rig par byos shig /
analyzed: des kyang de la tshod rig par byos shig /
translated: He should also say to him, “Please be moderate.”

original: ci ste dge 'dun las 'thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ci ste dge 'dun las 'thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If, on the other hand, he obtains it from the Saṅgha,

original: snod dag bkrus la tshang mang du song ste /
analyzed: snod dag bkrus la tshang mang du song ste /
translated: having washed the vessel, he should go to the kitchen

original: gtsang sbyor la dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtsang sbyor la dri bar bya ste /
translated: and ask the sweeper,

original: tshe dang ldan pa deng dge 'dun gyi skyu rum ci zhig byas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa deng dge 'dun gyi skyu rum ci zhig byas /
translated: “Venerable, what will the Saṅgha do with the myrobalan plums today?”

original: des kyang gus par gyis la /
analyzed: des kyang gus par gyis la /
translated: He should also say to him, “Please be respectful.”

original: de la smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la smra bar bya'o //
translated: He should say this to him.

original: de nas des mkhan po la /
analyzed: de nas des mkhan po la /
translated: Then, he should say to the preceptor,

original: mkhan po dge 'dun gyi skyu rum @346a *//
analyzed: mkhan po dge 'dun gyi skyu rum @346a *//
translated: “Preceptor, these are the beans of the Saṅgha.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bgyis na /
translated: If you do this or that,

original: de las gang bzhed pa de blang du gsol /🔽zhes smros shig /
analyzed: de las gang bzhed pa de blang du gsol / zhes smros shig /
translated: please take whatever you wish.”

original: des kyang drod rig par byos shig /
analyzed: des kyang drod rig par byos shig /
translated: “You should also check the temperature.

original: de nas phyogs gang du mkhan pos lag pa bkrus pa'i sa phyogs der dkyil 'khor byos la /
analyzed: de nas phyogs gang du mkhan pos lag pa bkrus pa'i sa phyogs der dkyil 'khor byos la /
translated: Then, in the place where the preceptor washes his hands, you should make an altar.

original: stan dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / 'dag chal dang / so shing dag nye bar gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: stan dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / 'dag chal dang / so shing dag nye bar gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: Place a seat, a water vessel, a washcloth, and a tooth cleaner there.

original: mkhan po'i rkang pa yang bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po'i rkang pa yang bkru bar bya'o //
translated: You should also wash the preceptor’s feet.

original: rkang pa bkrus nas lha ma gnyis byi dor byas te sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa bkrus nas lha ma gnyis byi dor byas te sbyin par bya'o //
translated: After washing his feet, you should massage his two feet and give him a gift.

original: khrus mi byed na chu dang / sa dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dag sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus mi byed na chu dang / sa dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dag sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If he does not want to wash, you should give him a vessel for water, a vessel for earth, and a vessel for oil.

original: de nas zas kyi snyoms pa bsdus nas /
analyzed: de nas zas kyi snyoms pa bsdus nas /
translated: Then, after collecting the leftovers from the meal,

original: mkhan po la ci 'di nyid du dge ba'i phyogs mdzad dam /
analyzed: mkhan po la ci 'di nyid du dge ba'i phyogs mdzad dam /
translated: you should ask the preceptor, ‘Will you do your spiritual practice here,

original: 'on te nyin par gnas par gshegs /
analyzed: 'on te nyin par gnas par gshegs /
translated: or will you go to the day-time dwelling?’

original: zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: This is how you should question them.🔽

original: gal te nyin par gnas par 'gro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te nyin par gnas par 'gro zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, “I will stay during the day,”

original: des stan blangs nas 'gro zhing /🔽nyin par gnas par phyag dar dang / chag chag byos la /
analyzed: des stan blangs nas 'gro zhing / nyin par gnas par phyag dar dang / chag chag byos la /
translated: he should take his seat and go.

original: stan gding bar bya zhing /
analyzed: stan gding bar bya zhing /
translated: He should sweep the place where he will stay during the day, sprinkle it with water, and lay out the seat.

original: dus dus su ba lang gzhon nu'i lci bas bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus dus su ba lang gzhon nu'i lci bas bsku bar bya'o //
translated: From time to time, he should sprinkle it with water that contains living organisms.

original: gal te bklag pa rgyas par byed na de la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bklag pa rgyas par byed na de la bstan par bya'o //
translated: If he is going to recite texts, he should be taught the texts.

original: ci ste bsam gtan rgyas par byed na yid la bya ba bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste bsam gtan rgyas par byed na yid la bya ba bstan par bya'o //
translated: If he is going to practice meditation, he should be taught the mental contemplations.

original: nyin par gnas pa nas 'ongs nas /
analyzed: nyin par gnas pa nas 'ongs nas /
translated: When he has returned from staying during the day,

original: mal stan brtags nas lag pa dang rkang pa bkrus te mchod rten la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: mal stan brtags nas lag pa dang rkang pa bkrus te mchod rten la phyag bya'o //
translated: he should inspect the sleeping area, wash his feet, and then pay homage to the stūpa.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la yang phyag byos la /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la yang phyag byos la /
translated: He should also pay homage to the practitioners.

original: mkhan po'i khri'u dang / chu dang / lham dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dag nye bar @346b gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po'i khri'u dang / chu dang / lham dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dag nye bar @346b gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should set out the preceptor’s seat, water for drinking, water for washing, and the oil vessel.

original: gal te rkang pa 'khru na bkrus la bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rkang pa 'khru na bkrus la bsku bar bya'o //
translated: If he is going to wash his feet, he should do so and then anoint them.

original: de lta ma yin na chu dang sa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chu dang sa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If not, he should set out water and earth.

original: gal te grang ba'i dus su gyur na dus byin gyis rlobs la me bud par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te grang ba'i dus su gyur na dus byin gyis rlobs la me bud par bya'o //
translated: If it is cold, he should make a fire, having first informed the preceptor or teacher.

original: dro bar gyur na glor bsil yab gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dro bar gyur na glor bsil yab gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If it is warm, he should fan the preceptor or teacher with a palm-leaf fan.

original: des kyang dus shes par bya ste bzlas pa dang / kha ton byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: des kyang dus shes par bya ste bzlas pa dang / kha ton byed du gzhug go //
translated: He should also know the right time to recite scriptures and to study.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa las gang cung zad ci bya ba de thams cad sngar mkhan po dang / slob dpon gyi byas la phyis bdag gi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa las gang cung zad ci bya ba de thams cad sngar mkhan po dang / slob dpon gyi byas la phyis bdag gi bya'o //
translated: Whatever work needs to be done for the preceptor or teacher, such as cleaning the alms-bowl, he should do it all, but only after he has first done whatever work needs to be done for himself.

original: ngag ldan / lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye gnas dag gis mkhan po dang / slob dpon la de ltar nye bar bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: ngag ldan / lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye gnas dag gis mkhan po dang / slob dpon la de ltar nye bar bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: A pupil or student should serve his preceptor or teacher in this way.

original: rnam pa de lta bus mkhan po dang slob dpon la lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis bsgrubs na chu'i nang gi me tog autpa la bzhin du dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus mkhan po dang slob dpon la lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye gnas rnams kyis bsgrubs na chu'i nang gi me tog autpa la bzhin du dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro ////
translated: If pupils and students serve their preceptor or teacher in this way, then, like a blue lotus in water, they will flourish with wholesome qualities.

original: 'dul ba phran tshegs kyi gzhi /
analyzed: 'dul ba phran tshegs kyi gzhi /
translated: The Bases of Discipline

original: bam po zhe dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po zhe dgu pa /
translated: Chapter One

original: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: The frame story is set in Rājagṛha.

original: de nas yang de'i tshe ri nag po la dge slong 'gro mgyogs dang / nab so dang / dge slong dmar ser dag khyim sun 'byin pa /
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe ri nag po la dge slong 'gro mgyogs dang / nab so dang / dge slong dmar ser dag khyim sun 'byin pa /
translated: At that time, the monks Tundulla, Revata, and the monk Kālidāsa were staying on Black Mountain.

original: sdig pa'i chos kun tu spyod pa dag gnas so //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos kun tu spyod pa dag gnas so //
translated: They were householders who were guilty of evil deeds.

original: de dag bud med dag dang lhan cig tu 'dug /
analyzed: de dag bud med dag dang lhan cig tu 'dug /
translated: They sat together with women,

original: lhan cig kha dpya zer /🔽lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: lhan cig kha dpya zer / lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: they joked together,🔽they played together,

original: lhan cig ca co 'don //
analyzed: lhan cig ca co 'don //
translated: they laughed together,

original: 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus kyis snyogs par byed /
analyzed: 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus kyis snyogs par byed /
translated: they made gestures with their bodies,

original: stan gcig la 'dug par byed /
analyzed: stan gcig la 'dug par byed /
translated: they sat on the same seats,

original: snod gcig tu longs spyod par byed /
analyzed: snod gcig tu longs spyod par byed /
translated: they used the same vessels,

original: phor bu gcig tu chang rnam pa mang po 'thung bar byed /
analyzed: phor bu gcig tu chang rnam pa mang po 'thung bar byed /
translated: they drank many kinds of beer from the same cups,

original: me tog 'thog par byed /🔽'thog tu 'jug @347a *//
analyzed: me tog 'thog par byed / 'thog tu 'jug @347a *//
translated: they picked flowers,🔽they had others pick them,

original: phreng ba brgyud par byed /
analyzed: phreng ba brgyud par byed /
translated: they strung garlands,

original: brgyud du 'jug /
analyzed: brgyud du 'jug /
translated: they had others string them,

original: me tog rgyan dag 'ching zhing 'ching du 'jug /🔽gar byed / byed du 'jug /
analyzed: me tog rgyan dag 'ching zhing 'ching du 'jug / gar byed / byed du 'jug /
translated: they made flower ornaments, they had others make them,🔽they danced,🔽they had others dance,

original: glu len par byed /
analyzed: glu len par byed /
translated: they sang,

original: rol mo'i cha byad 'bud par byed /🔽'bud du 'jug /
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad 'bud par byed /🔽'bud du 'jug /
translated: they played musical instruments,🔽they had others play musical instruments,

original: gar mkhas pa dang / glu snyan pa dang / rol mo'i cha byad 'bud mkhas pa la gla sbyin par byed /
analyzed: gar mkhas pa dang / glu snyan pa dang / rol mo'i cha byad 'bud mkhas pa la gla sbyin par byed /
translated: They are skilled in dance, singing, and playing musical instruments.

original: gos rnams brdzes nas rgyug par byed /🔽mchong bar byed /
analyzed: gos rnams brdzes nas rgyug par byed / mchong bar byed /
translated: They run around with their clothes in disarray.🔽They jump.

original: rgal bar byed /
analyzed: rgal bar byed /
translated: They swim.

original: rkang pa gcig bskum ste skor bar byed /🔽lag 'gros kyis kyang skor bar byed /
analyzed: rkang pa gcig bskum ste skor bar byed / lag 'gros kyis kyang skor bar byed /
translated: They circle with one leg drawn in.🔽They circle with their arms.

original: nya tshar gyis kyang skor bar byed /
analyzed: nya tshar gyis kyang skor bar byed /
translated: They circle with their fins.

original: chu bgags shing gtong bar byed /🔽chu la sbal pa'i skad 'byin /
analyzed: chu bgags shing gtong bar byed / chu la sbal pa'i skad 'byin /
translated: They block and release the water.🔽They make the sound of frogs in the water.

original: chu la rnga'i sgra yang 'byin /🔽glang po che'i skad kyang 'byin /
analyzed: chu la rnga'i sgra yang 'byin / glang po che'i skad kyang 'byin /
translated: They make the sound of drums in the water.🔽They make the sound of elephants.

original: khrung khrung gi skad kyang 'byin /🔽rta'i skad kyang 'byin /
analyzed: khrung khrung gi skad kyang 'byin / rta'i skad kyang 'byin /
translated: They make the sound of cranes.🔽They make the sound of horses.

original: khyu mchog 'gying pa'i skad kyang 'byin /🔽khas rdza rnga'i sgra yang 'byin /
analyzed: khyu mchog 'gying pa'i skad kyang 'byin / khas rdza rnga'i sgra yang 'byin /
translated: They make the sound of bulls strutting.🔽They make the sound of clay drums with their mouths.

original: khas dung dang / khas rnga dang / rma bya'i skad kyang 'byin /
analyzed: khas dung dang / khas rnga dang / rma bya'i skad kyang 'byin /
translated: They make the sound of conches, drums, and peacocks with their mouths.

original: khu byug gi skad kyang 'byin /
analyzed: khu byug gi skad kyang 'byin /
translated: They make the sound of cuckoos.

original: glang po che'i 'thab mo yang byed /
analyzed: glang po che'i 'thab mo yang byed /
translated: They fight like elephants.

original: rta'i 'thab mo dang / khyu mchog gi 'thab mo dang / ma he'i 'thab mo dang / ra'i 'thab mo dang / lug thug gi 'thab mo dang / bud med kyi 'thab mo dang / skyes pa'i 'thab mo dang / gzhon nu ma'i 'thab mo dang /
analyzed: rta'i 'thab mo dang / khyu mchog gi 'thab mo dang / ma he'i 'thab mo dang / ra'i 'thab mo dang / lug thug gi 'thab mo dang / bud med kyi 'thab mo dang / skyes pa'i 'thab mo dang / gzhon nu ma'i 'thab mo dang /
translated: They would also stage horse fights, bull fights, buffalo fights, goat fights, sheep fights, woman fights, man fights, and girl fights.

original: bya gag gi 'thab mo dang / sreg pa'i 'thab mo dang / 'ur pa'i 'thab mo dang / bya gag dang / sreg pa dang / 'ur pa dag gi 'thab mo yang byed /🔽byed du 'jug cing /
analyzed: bya gag gi 'thab mo dang / sreg pa'i 'thab mo dang / 'ur pa'i 'thab mo dang / bya gag dang / sreg pa dang / 'ur pa dag gi 'thab mo yang byed / byed du 'jug cing /
translated: They would stage fights between cocks, quails, and sparrows, and would make others do the same.

original: gzhan yang dge sbyong gi las ma yin pa byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge sbyong gi las ma yin pa byed de /
translated: They would also do things that are not the work of ascetics.

original: de dag gi tshul dang / spyod @347b pa dang / log par sgrub pa des ri nag por dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams ni mi 'ong zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi tshul dang / spyod @347b pa dang / log par sgrub pa des ri nag por dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams ni mi 'ong zhing /
translated: Because of their conduct, behavior, and wrong practice, no nuns would come to Black Mountain,

original: 'ongs pa rnams kyang mi 'dod pas ri nag po'i gnas 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'ongs pa rnams kyang mi 'dod pas ri nag po'i gnas 'dor bar byed do //
translated: and those who had come would leave the nunnery on Black Mountain because they did not like it there.

original: ri nag po na gnas pa'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams 'di ltar dge slong 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi las ma yin pa byed do zhes kha zer bar byed /
analyzed: ri nag po na gnas pa'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams 'di ltar dge slong 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi las ma yin pa byed do zhes kha zer bar byed /
translated: They criticized them,

original: 'phya bar byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phya bar byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed do //
translated: and spread it about.

original: zhes skabs de dge slong rnams kyis thos nas /
analyzed: zhes skabs de dge slong rnams kyis thos nas /
translated: When the monks heard about this,🔽they reported it to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag kha zer zhing 'phya ba dang / phyar ka gtong ba ni gnas yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag kha zer zhing 'phya ba dang / phyar ka gtong ba ni gnas yin te /
translated: Monks, it is not surprising that brahmins and householders should criticize, spread it about, and say, These monks are doing things that are not the work of ascetics.

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa'i las de lta bu mi bya zhing byed du yang mi gzhug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa'i las de lta bu mi bya zhing byed du yang mi gzhug go //
translated: Therefore, monks, you should not do such things that are not the work of ascetics, nor should you let others do them.

original: dge slong dag gis de lta bu'i dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa'i las byas sam byed du bcug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis de lta bu'i dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa'i las byas sam byed du bcug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If monks do such things that are not the work of ascetics, or let others do them, they become guilty of an offense.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Vulture Peak in Rājagṛha.

original: de nas yang de'i tshe lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ma ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / yul spong byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par gyur nas /
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ma ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / yul spong byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par gyur nas /
translated: At that time, Ajātaśatru, the king of Magadha, son of Vaidehī, and the people of the country of Vṛji were at odds with each other.

original: des 'khor de rnams la tshig 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: des 'khor de rnams la tshig 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to his retinue,

original: ngas yul spong byed ba rnams 'byor ba dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba 'di gzhom par bya /🔽thal bar bya /
analyzed: ngas yul spong byed ba rnams 'byor ba dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba 'di gzhom par bya / thal bar bya /
translated: I will destroy this prosperous, flourishing, happy, well-populated country of Vṛji,🔽reduce it to ashes,

original: tshul ma yin pas rmeg med par bya'o zhes smras so //🔽de nas lus 'phags ma'i bu yul @348a *//
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas rmeg med par bya'o zhes smras so // de nas lus 'phags ma'i bu yul @348a *//
translated: and utterly annihilate it.🔽Then Ajātaśatru, the king of Magadha, son of Vaidehī,

original: ma ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgras yul ma ga dha'i sna chen po la gtogs pa'i bram ze dbyar byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ma ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgras yul ma ga dha'i sna chen po la gtogs pa'i bram ze dbyar byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Varṣākāra, the chief minister of Magadha:

original: dbyar byed tshur shog /
analyzed: dbyar byed tshur shog /
translated: Come here, Varṣākāra!

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song la /
translated: Go to the Blessed One

original: song nas nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byos la /🔽gnod pa chung ngam /
analyzed: song nas nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byos la / gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: and, having arrived, bow your head at the feet of the Blessed One on my behalf🔽and ask him if he has little trouble,🔽little illness,

original: nyam nga ba mi ma nga'am /🔽bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba mi ma nga'am / bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: little affliction,🔽if he is strong,🔽well,

original: 'tsho'am / stobs dang / bde ba la reg par gnas sam /🔽kha na ma tho ba mi mnga'am /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / stobs dang / bde ba la reg par gnas sam / kha na ma tho ba mi mnga'am /
translated: and living in touch with the bliss of his state of being,

original: zhes snyun gsol la /
analyzed: zhes snyun gsol la /
translated: and if he is without any troubles.

original: 'di skad ces btsun pa lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / yul spong byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par gyur te /🔽des 'khor rnams la tshig 'di skad ces mchi'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces btsun pa lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ga dha'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang / yul spong byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par gyur te / des 'khor rnams la tshig 'di skad ces mchi'o //
translated: Say this: ‘Lord, King Ajātaśatru, the son of Vaidehī, and the people of Vṛji are not on good terms with each other.

original: ngas yul spong byed pa rnams 'byor ba dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba 'di gzhom par bya //🔽thal bar bya /
analyzed: ngas yul spong byed pa rnams 'byor ba dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba 'di gzhom par bya // thal bar bya /
translated: He has said to his retinue, “I will destroy this Vṛji, which is prosperous, flourishing, happy, with an abundance of food and filled with many people.🔽I will reduce it to ashes.

original: tshul ma yin pas rmeg med par bya'o zhes mchi na /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas rmeg med par bya'o zhes mchi na /
translated: I will utterly destroy it.”

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ci stsal /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ci stsal /
translated: What did the Bhagavān say to that?🔽

original: ces zhus la /
